author: ryanleeschneider
content: Random question RE: network naming post-merge: so, for Kiln both the EL and CL networks are named `kiln`.  For the existing networks, will Goerli/Prater get some new combined named, or will we need to run our CLs w/ `--network prater` and ELs w/ `--network goerli`?  Actually for that matter will the CL networks that are created for ropsten and sepolia have unique CL-style names or will they simply be `ropsten` and `sepolia`?

author: ajsutton
content: At least initially CL --network prater and EL --network goerli.  Probably makes sense to move to a single name - clients could potentially alias goerli and prater to mean the same thing to make the migration smoother.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Oh ya I like that alias idea, also avoids figuring out what the new combined name would be ðŸ™‚

author: timbeiko
content: <@388751025789468672> we do need to pick a name for the beacon chains for Ropsten and Sepolia. Do you think we should just call them the same thing on the CL?

author: paulhauner
content: I would lean towards calling them the same thing on the CL. I think it would be consistent with what we're going to do with mainnet. Prater is a bit of an unfortunate outlier, I agree with eventually renaming it to Goerli (to whatever degree is practical, I assume Prater will linger forever).

author: djrtwo
content: yeah, ropsten beacon chain, sepolia beacon chain plz

content: Hi, just wondering is there an estimate for msf4 ttd?
